question_context.question_text: ¿El plan justifica su alcance en niñez y juventud mencionando el marco legal (Código de Infancia y Adolescencia, Ley de Juventud) o reconociendo restricciones explícitas de tipo presupuestal o de competencias?

patterns.pattern: en el marco de la Ley 1098 de 2006|Código de la Infancia y la Adolescencia
Política 'De Cero a Siempre'|Política Nacional de Juventud
competencias del municipio en|responsabilidad del ICBF|SNBF
recursos del SGP para primera infancia y educación
restricción presupuestal para ampliar la cobertura del PAE
capacidad limitada de la Comisaría de Familia
coherencia entre metas y recursos disponibles|factibilidad financiera y técnica

signal_requirements.note: Signal requirements are under development. Canonical mapping pending for PA06/DIM01; mandatory_signals and optional_signals are intentionally empty to avoid blocking execution.

elements.description: Lista de elementos de evidencia encontrados para esta micro-pregunta.

pattern_matches.description: Matches de patrones esperados vs texto.

assembly_rules.description: Combine evidence elements from 7 method invocations
Combine metadata from 7 methods for full traceability

question_global.description: Índice global de la pregunta (de questionnaire_monolith).

policy_area_id.description: PA canónica, debe ser coherente con identity.policy_area_id.

cluster_id.description: Cluster de análisis según el monolith, si aplica.

evidence.description: Objeto de evidencia ensamblado por el EvidenceNexus; debe cumplir evidence_assembly.output_schema.

validation.description: Resultado de validaciones lógicas de la respuesta (coherencia, integridad, etc.).

trace.description: Información de trazabilidad (provenance, logs) específica de la ejecución.

metadata.description: Metadatos adicionales de la pregunta para consumo posterior.

template.title: ## Análisis Q185: PA06 - D1-Q5
template.summary:
### Resumen Ejecutivo

**Área de política**: Derecho al buen futuro de la niñez, adolescencia, juventud y entornos protectores

**Dimensión**: INSUMOS

Se analizó la presencia de **{evidence.elements_found_count}** elementos de evidencia relevantes.

**Puntaje**: {score}/3.0 | **Calidad**: {quality_level}

epistemological_foundation.ontological_basis: The meaning and validity of a causal claim depends on its textual context (surrounding sentences, semantic coherence)
epistemological_foundation.epistemological_stance: Coherentist: A causal link is epistemically justified if it coheres with surrounding textual evidence
theoretical_framework: Semantic coherence theory: Valid claims are embedded in coherent semantic contexts
Evidential reasoning: Context provides supporting or undermining evidence for causal claims
epistemological_foundation.justification: Detecting a causal connector alone is insufficient; analyzing surrounding text validates whether the link is substantive or superficial

technical_approach.algorithm: Extract ±N sentences around link, analyze semantic consistency

steps.description: Extract context window (±3 sentences) around detected causal link
Calculate semantic similarity between link and context using embeddings
Identify supporting/contradicting evidence in context

assumptions: Coherent contexts indicate valid causal claims
Context window of ±3 sentences captures relevant information
limitations: May miss long-range dependencies beyond context window
Semantic similarity doesn't guarantee logical validity
technical_approach.complexity: O(k*w) where k=links, w=context window size

output_structure.supporting_evidence: Contextual sentences that support the link
output_structure.contradicting_evidence: Contextual sentences that contradict the link

interpretation_guide.low_coherence: <0.5: Link may be spurious or poorly contextualized

actionable_insights: Low coherence + many links: Document has scattered causal claims without substantiation
High coherence: Causal claims are evidence-based and well-argued

method_combination_logic.combination_strategy: Sequential multi-method pipeline with evidence fusion
method_combination_logic.rationale: D1-Q5 (Q185) for PA06/DIM01 requires consistent extraction, validation, and synthesis across 7 methods. This block documents how the pipeline combines method outputs into a single evidence product.
method_combination_logic.evidence_fusion: Evidence from all methods is aggregated by the EvidenceNexus according to evidence_assembly. Overlaps are deduplicated where possible and confidence is propagated conservatively.
method_combination_logic.confidence_aggregation: Confidence is aggregated via contract-defined merge strategies, favoring calibrated methods when available.
trade_offs: Coverage vs. cost: using 7 methods increases coverage but raises computation and maintenance burden.
Recall vs. precision: multiple detectors increase recall but can introduce redundancy; deduplication and weighting mitigate this.
Sophistication vs. interpretability: advanced models can be less transparent; human_readable_output documents assumptions and limitations.

rules.description: Auto-generated: require all required expected_elements types
Auto-generated: encourage optional evidence types when available

traceability.provenance_note: This contract was generated with full multi-method orchestration support. The method_binding.methods array contains all 7 methods from D1_Q5_Executor, and human_answer_structure documents the expected evidence output after execution.

fallback_strategy.note: No fallback strategies enabled. All failures propagate according to error_handling configuration.

calibration.note: Contract does not embed calibration scores. Actual calibration managed via src/farfan_core/core/calibration/ + config/intrinsic_calibration.json + config/fusion_specification.json

human_answer_structure.description: Expected structure of evidence dict after all 7 methods execute and evidence is assembled according to assembly_rules

assembly_flow.step_1_method_execution: 7 methods execute in priority order, outputs stored with dot-notation keys
assembly_flow.step_2_evidence_assembly: EvidenceNexus merges outputs according to assembly_rules
assembly_flow.step_4_output_generation: Phase2QuestionResult constructed with evidence, validation, trace

evidence_structure_schema.description: Assembled evidence after all methods complete

elements_found.description: Concatenated evidence elements from multiple methods (assembly_rules target)
